c74object.name: hoa.stereo~
c74object.digest: An ambisonic decoder for stereophonic system.
c74object.description:
hoa.stereo~
decodes an ambisonic soundfield for stereophonic system. First argument is the order of the ambisonic soundfield, second is the angle between the two loudspeakers in degrees (60째). It uses fractional orders and inPhase optimization to keep a perceptive linear panning between the two louspeakers, send "infos" message to print the current configuration of the object.

metadatalist.metadata: hoa.library by Julien Colafrancesco, Pierre Guillot, Eliott Paris.

objarg.name: loudspeakers-angles
objarg.digest: Sets the angle between the two loudspeakers in degrees (default is 60째).

entry.name: fractional order
entry.description: hoa.stereo~ works for all the loudspeakers positions and all the ambisonic orders. Higher is the order, better is the restitution so it seems that for a "classical" stereo (60째), the best order is 7. For a lower distance between loudspeakers, you should use higher orders to increase the restitution. Reciprocally, you can use lower orders to preserve the cpu if the distance between the loudspeakers is higher.
